name: Companies with domestic R&D paid for by the company and others and performed by the company in the biotechnology focus area, by industry and company size: 2015
description: Companies with domestic R&D paid for by the company and others and performed by the company in the biotechnology focus area, by industry and company size: 2015

creator.name: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics

variableMeasured.name: field_domestic_r_d_companies_number_a
variableMeasured.description: Domestic R D Companies Number A

variableMeasured.name: field_biotechnology_r_d_total_companies_number_b
variableMeasured.description: Biotechnology R D Total Companies Number B

variableMeasured.name: field_biotechnology_r_d_paid_for_by_company_companies_number_b
variableMeasured.description: Biotechnology R D Paid For By Company Companies Number B

variableMeasured.name: field_biotechnology_r_d_paid_for_by_company_amount
variableMeasured.description: Biotechnology R D Paid For By Company Amount

variableMeasured.name: field_biotechnology_r_d_paid_for_by_others_companies_number_b
variableMeasured.description: Biotechnology R D Paid For By Others Companies Number B

variableMeasured.name: field_biotechnology_r_d_paid_for_by_others_amount
variableMeasured.description: Biotechnology R D Paid For By Others Amount

specialValues.D: suppressed to avoid disclosure of confidential information

notes: Detail may not add to total because of rounding. Industry classification is based on the dominant business code for domestic R&D performance, where available. For companies that did not report business codes, the classification used for sampling was assigned. Statistics are representative of companies located in the United States that performed or funded R&D. Some R&D may be reported in more than one application area. Some R&D is not classified in any application area.
sources: National Science Foundation, National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics, and U.S. Census Bureau, Business R&D and Innovation Survey, 2015.
